intro: Stenospermation benavidesae, commonly known as the Benavides' narrow-seeded plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
